document_title: Carpal tunnel syndrome: Causes, symptoms and treatments
subsection_content:
Prolonged compression of the median nerve causes the patient to have carpal tunnel stenosis, causing pain, numbness, reduced or loss of sensation in the skin area of ​​the hand under the control of the median nerve, and in more severe cases, it can cause muscle atrophy and reduced function. and hand movements.
Note: Complications also occur similarly in patients with tarsal tunnel syndrome if not treated promptly!
If detected early and treated promptly, the disease can be completely cured, otherwise it will cause lasting damage and sequelae that greatly affect the patient's life and work. According to statistics in the US, every year there are about 200,000 surgical treatments, so workers have to quit their jobs, affecting their economic life, along with the cost of treatment.
